{{Marriage|Debrah Lee Charatan|2000}} | alma_mater = [[Lehigh University]] (B.A. Economics, 1965) | education = [[Scarsdale High School]] | parents = [[Seymour Durst]]
[[Bernice Herstein]] | occupation = }} '''Robert Alan Durst''' (born April 12, 1943){{cite book|last1=Collins|first1=Marion|title=Without a Trace|date=November 18, 2002|publisher=McMillan|location=New York|isbn=0-312-98502-9|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jNadyEUsW98C&pg=PA13&dq=Robert+Durst+april+1943#v=onepage&q=Robert%20Durst%20april%201943&f=false}} is an American [[real estate]] [[heir]], the son of New York City mogul [[Seymour Durst]], and the elder brother of [[Douglas Durst]], head of the [[Durst Organization]]. He is suspected of murdering three individuals in different states: Kathleen McCormack Durst, his first wife, who disappeared in New York in 1982; [[Susan Berman]], his longtime friend, who was killed in California in 2000; and his neighbor, Morris Black, who was killed in Texas in 2001. Durst was the subject of a multi-state [[manhunt (law enforcement)|manhunt]] and was ultimately convicted of dismembering Black, but [[acquittal|acquitted]] of his murder. On March 14, 2015, Durst was arrested in New Orleans on a [[first-degree murder]] warrant signed by a Los Angeles judge in relation to the Berman killing. On November 4, 2016, he was transferred to California and soon after was [[Arraignment|arraigned]] in Los Angeles on [[first-degree murder]] charges. A preliminary hearing was initially scheduled for October 2017{{cite news|url=http://www.ocregister.com/2017/02/10/durst-attorneys-agree-to-preliminary-hearing-in-october/|title=Durst Attorneys Agree to Preliminary Hearing in October|newspaper=[[Orange County Register]]|publisher=[[Digital First Media]]|location=Anaheim, California|date=February 10, 2017|accessdate=May 19, 2017}} but was postponed to April 2018{{cite news |first=Marisa|last=Gerber|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-la-durst-hearing-20170920-story.html |title=Key hearing in Robert Durst murder case postponed until April |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=September 20, 2017 |accessdate=October 7, 2017}} and concluded in October 2018 with Los Angeles Country Superior Judge Mark Windham ruling there is enough evidence to try Durst for the shooting of Berman.http://thejewishvoice.com/2018/10/31/judge-rules-that-ny-real-estate-heir-durst-stand-trial-for-murder/ ==Early life== One of four children, Robert Durst grew up in [[Scarsdale, New York]]. He is the son of [[real estate]] investor [[Seymour Durst]] and his wife [[Bernice Herstein]]. His siblings are [[Douglas Durst|Douglas]], Tommy, and Wendy. Durst's paternal grandfather, [[Joseph Durst]], a penniless [[Jewish]] tailor when he emigrated from [[Austria-Hungary]] in 1902, eventually became a very successful real estate manager and developer, founding the [[Durst Organization]] in 1927. Seymour Durst became head of the family business in 1974 upon his father's death.{{cite news|first=Dana|last=Rubinstein |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052748704482704576072202098963980 |title=New York Real Estate: Douglas Durst Takes Helm to Change City Landscape |newspaper=[[Wall Street Journal]] |publisher=[[Dow Jones & Company]]|location=new York City|date=January 10, 2011 |accessdate=December 18, 2016}} When Robert was seven, his mother died as a result of a fall from the family's Scarsdale home; he later claimed that, moments before her death, his father walked him to a window from which he could see her standing on the roof. In a March 2015 ''[[The New York Times|New York Times]]'' interview, however, his brother Douglas denied this.{{cite news|first=Jim|last=Dwyer|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/18/nyregion/a-durst-sibling-recounts-the-violent-ripples-below-a-charming-surface.html?_r=0|title=A Durst Sibling Recounts the Violent Ripples Below a Charming Surface|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=New York Times Company|date=March 17, 2015|accessdate=December 18, 2016}}{{cite news| first = Jonathan|last=Bandler| title =Robert Durst admits lying about wife's disappearance on HBO|url=http://www.lohud.com/story/news/local/2015/02/06/robert-durst-hbo-jinx-documentary/22999161/|newspaper =[[The Journal News]] | publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=New York City| date = February 7, 2015| accessdate =March 15, 2015| quote =Robert Durst addresses her 1950 suicide at the family's home in Scarsdale when he was 7. Durst claims his father, Seymour, walked him over to a hall window and showed him Bernice Durst standing on the roof. "I waved at Mommy. I don't know if she saw me," he said. "It never went through my mind that, 'What is she doing on the roof in her nightie?'" He didn't see her fall but said he heard the maid shouting, "'She's off the roof.'" "I never forgot it," he said. "It never left me."}} As children, Robert and Douglas underwent counseling for sibling rivalry;{{cite news|first1=Charles V.|last1=Bagli |first2=Kevin|last2=Flynn | title =A Two-Decade Spiral Into Suspicion; Long After Wife Disappears, Heir Vanishes After Texas Murder|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2001/10/21/nyregion/two-decade-spiral-into-suspicion-long-after-wife-disappears-heir-vanishes-after.html|newspaper =[[The New York Times]]| publisher=New York Times Company|location=New York City|date = October 21, 2001| accessdate =March 15, 2015|quote = In any event, Robert's childhood battles with Douglas prompted their father to send both boys to a counselor.}} a 1953 psychiatrist's report on 10-year-old Robert mentioned "personality decomposition and possibly even [[schizophrenia]]".{{cite news|first=Dan|last=Reilly|url=http://www.vulture.com/2015/04/robert-durst-biographer-jinx-factually-incorrect.html|title=Robert Durst Biographer Matt Birkbeck on What The Jinx Got Wrong|work=[[Vulture (website)|Vulture.com]]|publisher=[[New York Media]]|location=New York City|date=April 15, 2015|accessdate=April 16, 2015}} Durst attended [[Scarsdale High School]], where classmates described him as a loner.{{cite news|last1=Bagli|first1=Charles V.|last2=Flynn|first2=Kevin|title=A Two-Decade Spiral Into Suspicion; Long After Wife Disappears, Heir Vanishes After Texas Murder|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2001/10/21/nyregion/two-decade-spiral-into-suspicion-long-after-wife-disappears-heir-vanishes-after.html?pagewanted=all|work=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=New York Times Company|location=New York City|date=October 21, 2001|accessdate=June 22, 2018}} He earned a [[bachelor's degree]] in Economics in 1965 from [[Lehigh University]], where he was a member of the [[Lehigh Mountain Hawks men's lacrosse|varsity lacrosse team]] and the business manager of ''The Brown and White'' [[student newspaper]].{{cite news|first=Sarah|last=Freeman|title=Alum's Deadly Decisions: The killer story that inspired the new movie, 'All Good Things'|url=http://digital.lib.lehigh.edu/cgi-bin/showpdf.exe?CISOROOT=/bw2&CISOPTR=73439&CISOPAGE=7|work=The Brown and White|publisher=[[Lehigh University]]|location=Bethlehem, Pennsylvania|date=January 28, 2011}}{{cite news|first1=Charles V.|last1=Bagli |first2=Susan|last2=Saulny | title =Millionaire Fugitive Has Been Caught, but Mysteries Remain| newspaper =[[The New York Times]]|publisher=New York Times Company|location=New York City| date = December 2, 2001|accessdate =March 15, 2015|quote = He had spent four years at Lehigh University, graduating in 1965.| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2001/12/02/nyregion/millionaire-fugitive-has-been-caught-but-mysteries-remain.html}} He enrolled in a doctoral program at [[University of California, Los Angeles|UCLA]] later that year, where he met [[Susan Berman]], but eventually withdrew from the school and returned to New York in 1969.{{cite journal|first=Gary|last=Cartwright|url=http://www.texasmonthly.com/content/durst-case-scenarios?fullpage=1|title=Durst Case Scenarios|journal=[[Texas Monthly]]|publisher=Genesis Park|location=Austin, Texas|date=February 2002|accessdate=June 22, 2018}} Durst went on to become a real estate developer in his father's business; however, it was his brother Douglas who was later appointed to run the family business in the 1990s. The appointment caused a rift between Robert and his family, [[family estrangement|estranging]] him from them.{{cite web|first=Selim|last=Algar|url=https://nypost.com/2015/01/03/douglas-durst-blasts-psychopath-brother-ahead-of-hbo-series/|title=NYC real-estate mogul: My killer brother is a dog-slaying monster|newspaper=[[New York Post]]|publisher=[[News Corp.]]|location=New York City|date=January 3, 2015|accessdate=June 22, 2018}} ==Crimes for which Durst has been investigated== Police have directly questioned Durst, and sometimes conducted searches, in connection to the disappearance of his first wife Kathie McCormack, and two homicides, Susan Berman and Morris Black. In one of those homicides, he was tried and acquitted. ===Disappearance of Kathleen McCormack Durst=== In the fall of 1971, Durst met Kathleen McCormack, a dental hygienist, whose nickname was "Kathie". After two dates, Durst invited McCormack to share his home in Vermont, where he had opened a health food store; she moved there in January 1972. However, Durst's father pressured him to move back to New York City to work in the family real estate business.{{cite news|first1=Charles V.|last1=Bagli |first2=Kevin|last2=Flynn|url =https://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/28/movies/28durst.html?pagewanted=all| title =That's Me on Screen, but I Still Didn't Do It| newspaper =[[The New York Times]]|location=New York City|date =November 24, 2010| accessdate =March 15, 2015}} Durst and McCormack returned to Manhattan, where they married in April 1973.{{cite news|url=http://www.lohud.com/story/news/crime/2015/03/17/robert-durst-timeline/24908191/|title=Robert Durst: A timeline|work=[[The Journal News]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=White Plains, New York|date=March 25, 2015|accessdate=April 20, 2015}} Shortly before her disappearance, McCormack was a student in her fourth and final year at the [[Albert Einstein College of Medicine]] in [[The Bronx]] and was only a few months short of earning her degree.{{Cite news|first1=Kevin|last1=Flynn|first2=Charles V.|last2=Bagli|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2001/03/06/nyregion/reopened-mystery-special-report-woman-s-disappearance-still-baffling-after-19.html|title=REOPENED MYSTERY: A special report.; A Woman's Disappearance Is Still Baffling After 19 Years|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=March 6, 2001|access-date=March 14, 2017|issn=0362-4331}} She had intended to become a pediatrician. McCormack was last seen by someone other than Durst the evening of January 31, 1982,{{Cite web|first=Meaghan|last=Good|url=http://www.charleyproject.org/cases/d/durst_kathleen.html|title=The Charley Project: Kathleen Durst Elizabeth|website=www.charleyproject.org|access-date=March 14, 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171213072427/http://charleyproject.org/cases/d/durst_kathleen.html|archivedate=December 13, 2017}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.doenetwork.org/cases/560dfny.html|title=The Doe Network: Case File 560DFNY|website=www.doenetwork.org|access-date=March 14, 2017}} at her best friend's [[Party#Dinner party|dinner party]] in [[Newtown, Connecticut]]. She had arrived unexpectedly and her friend noticed she was upset. She was also wearing red sweatpants, which the friend found odd since McCormack had often dressed in much better quality clothing. She later left for [[South Salem, New York]], after a call from her husband.{{cite news|first=Ned|last=Zeman|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/magazine/2015/03/robert-durst-murders-wife-susie-berman|title=The Fugitive Heir|work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|publisher=[[Condé Nast]]|location=New York City|date=February 2002|accessdate=March 17, 2015}}{{cite news|first1=John|last1=Burgeson|first2=Chris|last2=Mascaro|url=http://m.ctpost.com/local/article/Katherine-Durst-forged-a-persistent-friendship-6137637.php|title=Kathleen Durst forged a persistent friendship while at Western |work=[[Connecticut Post]]|publisher=[[Hearst Corporation]]|location=Bridgeport, Connecticut|date=March 16, 2015|accessdate=April 6, 2015}} Although the couple argued and fought, Durst maintained that he put his wife on a train to New York City, had a drink with a neighbor, and spoke to his wife by telephone later that evening.{{cite news|author=Jonathan Bandler|url=http://www.lohud.com/story/news/local/2015/02/06/robert-durst-hbo-jinx-documentary/22999161/|title=Robert Durst admits lying about wife's disappearance on HBO|date=February 7, 2015|accessdate=April 16, 2015|work=[[The Journal News]]}} "That's what I told police," Durst later told [[The Jinx (miniseries)|documentary filmmakers]]. "I was hoping that would just make everything go away." After McCormack had left her friend's house, she was supposed to meet her friend at a pub called The Lion's Gate in Manhattan. When she failed to show up, her friend became concerned and repeatedly called the police for several days. Days later, Durst filed a [[missing person]] report as well. A doorman at one of the two Manhattan apartments where the couple lived claimed to have seen McCormack there on February 1, which was one day after she was last seen, but also claimed that he had seen her only from behind and couldn't be 100% sure that it was her. McCormack had been treated at a Bronx [[hospital]] for facial bruises three weeks before. She told a friend that Durst beat her, yet she did not press charges over the incident. McCormack asked Durst for a $250,000 [[divorce]] settlement.{{cite news|url=https://nypost.com/2015/03/28/woman-who-inspired-the-beatles-dear-prudence-once-dated-robert-durst/|title=Woman who inspired The Beatles' 'Dear Prudence' once dated Robert Durst|work=[[New York Post]]|author1=Isabel Vincent |author2=Melissa Klein |lastauthoramp=yes |date=March 28, 2015|accessdate=March 29, 2015}} Durst cancelled his wife's credit card, removed her name from a joint bank account, and refused to pay her medical school tuition.{{cite news|url=http://www.vulture.com/2015/04/robert-dursts-all-good-things-dvd-commentary.html|title=The Creepiest Things Robert Durst Says in His ''All Good Things'' DVD Commentary|work=[[Vulture.com|New York Magazine (Vulture.com)]]|date=April 1, 2015|accessdate=April 1, 2015|author=Alex Palmer}} At the time his wife disappeared, Durst had been dating [[Prudence Farrow]] for three years and was living in a separate apartment.{{cite news|author1=Charles V. Bagli |author2=Kevin Flynn |lastauthoramp=yes | title =A Two-Decade Spiral Into Suspicion; Long After Wife Disappears, Heir Vanishes After Texas Murder| newspaper =[[The New York Times]]| date = October 21, 2001| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2001/10/21/nyregion/two-decade-spiral-into-suspicion-long-after-wife-disappears-heir-vanishes-after.html| accessdate =March 15, 2015}}{{cite news|date=December 4, 2000|accessdate=March 15, 2015|volume=54|number=24|title=Resuming the Search: Police Reopen the Case of Kathie Durst, Who Disappeared 18 Years Ago|author1=Bill Hewitt |author2=Matt Birkbeck |lastauthoramp=yes |work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20133152,00.html}} Durst initially offered $100,000 for his wife's return, then reduced the reward to $15,000. Only three weeks after reporting her missing, he was seen discarding his wife's possessions,{{cite news|author=Lisa Irizarry|work=[[Newsday]]|date=April 4, 2015|accessdate=April 4, 2015|url=http://www.newsday.com/long-island/nassau/robert-durst-s-arrest-brings-hope-of-justice-to-new-hyde-park-family-of-his-missing-first-wife-1.10195805|title=Robert Durst's arrest brings hope of justice to New Hyde Park family of his missing first wife}} which he denied. When McCormack's friend and sister had heard she was reported missing, they broke into her [[cottage]] hoping to find her. Instead, they found the cottage ransacked and McCormack's mail left unopened. They then became afraid and left. ====Investigation and aftermath==== After McCormack went missing, police said that Durst had claimed to have last spoken to her when she called him at their cottage from Manhattan. He claimed that the last time he had seen her was at [[Katonah (Metro-North station)|Katonah train station]],{{Cite news|url=http://www.lohud.com/story/news/crime/2015/01/27/robert-durst-wife-disappearance/22405297/|title=No answer to Kathie Durst's 1982 disappearance|work=lohud.com|access-date=2017-03-14|language=en}} where she was planning to board a 21:15 train to Manhattan. He also claimed that on February 4, the supervisor at her medical school called him and said that she had called in sick on February 1 and was absent from class for the entire week. It is uncertain if it was indeed McCormack who made the call. The day after Durst received the call from McCormack's medical school, he reported her as missing. The police found his stories to be full of contradictions. The McCormack family now wants Kathleen declared dead as they strongly believe she is deceased.{{Cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2016/03/31/family-wants-robert-dursts-missing-ex-declared-dead/|title=Family wants Robert Durst’s missing ex declared dead|last=Marsh|first=Julia|date=2016-03-31|website=New York Post|access-date=2017-03-14}} Her mother, Ann McCormack, had before attempted to sue Durst for $100 million.{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/crime/family-accuses-robert-durst-killing-wife-kathleen-suit-article-1.2450701|title=Family accuses Robert Durst of killing wife Kathleen in suit|work=NY Daily News|access-date=2017-03-14|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=http://gawker.com/family-of-still-missing-kathleen-mccormack-robert-durs-1745387670|title=Family of Still-Missing Kathleen McCormack, Robert Durst's First Wife, Sues Him for $100 Million|last=O'Connor|first=Brendan|work=Gawker|access-date=2017-03-14|language=en-US}} Kathleen's parents are now deceased.{{Cite news|url=http://news.nationalpost.com/news/world/i-just-want-to-find-out-what-happened-to-my-sister-kathie-durst|title='What happened to my sister'? After 35 years, family still searching for answers in Kathie Durst case|work=National Post|access-date=2017-03-14|language=en}} Kathleen's younger sister, Mary McCormack Hughes, also believes that Durst killed her.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/05/nyregion/35-years-later-sister-in-durst-case-is-still-looking-for-answers.html|title=35 Years Later, Sister in Durst Case Is Still Looking for Answers|last=Bagli|first=Charles V.|date=2017-02-05|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-03-14|issn=0362-4331}} The [[New York State Police]] quietly re-opened the criminal investigation into the disappearance in 1999, searching Durst's former South Salem residence for the first time. The investigation became public in November 2000. ===Homicide of Susan Berman=== On December 24, 2000, Berman, a longtime friend of Durst who had facilitated his public [[alibi]] after McCormack's disappearance and who had recently received $50,000 from Durst,{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/mar/29/robert-durst-jeanine-pirro-california-timeline-the-jinx|title=Did Robert Durst's nemesis ignore clues before following his trail to California?|date=March 29, 2015|accessdate=March 29, 2015|work=[[The Guardian]]|author=Andrew Gumbel}} was found murdered [[Execution-style murder|execution-style]] in her home in [[Benedict Canyon]], [[California]]. Durst is known to have been in Northern California days before Berman was killed, and to have flown from San Francisco to New York the night before Berman's body was discovered.{{cite news|title=Anonymous note suggests Durst link to pal's LA murder|url=http://www.lohud.com/story/news/local/2015/03/09/robert-durst-hbo-jinx-susan-berman/24664851/|author=Jonathan Bandler|work=[[The Journal News]]|date=March 9, 2015|accessdate=March 23, 2015}} Although Durst confirmed to the [[Los Angeles Police Department|LAPD]] that he had recently sent Berman $25,000, and faxed investigators a copy of her 1982 [[Deposition (law)|deposition]] regarding his missing wife, he declined to be further questioned about Berman's murder.{{cite news|url=http://documents.latimes.com/search-warrant-robert-dursts-houston-home/|title=Search Warrant for Robert Durst's Houston Home|work=[[Los Angeles Times]] (link to online public document)|date=March 18, 2015|accessdate=March 20, 2015}} Durst said in a 2005 deposition that Berman called him shortly before her death to say that Los Angeles police wanted to talk to her about McCormack's disappearance.{{cite news|url=http://mobile.nytimes.com/2015/04/01/nyregion/robert-dursts-wife-steps-back-after-years-of-defending-him.html|author=Charles V. Bagli|date=March 31, 2015|accessdate=March 31, 2015|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|title=Robert Durst's Wife Steps Back After Years of Defending Him}} A study of case notes by ''[[The Guardian]]'' cast doubt on whether the LAPD had made such a call, or whether then-[[Westchester County, New York|Westchester County]] District Attorney [[Jeanine Pirro]] had scheduled an interview with Berman at all. Durst moved to [[Galveston, Texas|Galveston]], [[Texas]], in 2000, lived in a [[boarding house]], and began posing as a woman to avoid police inquiries.{{cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/local/manhattan/killer_next_door_opu3qwpW1hQsVhmJVdpV7H | work=[[New York Post]] | first1=Rebecca | last1=Rosenberg | first2=Leonard | last2=Greene | title=Cross-dressing 'murderer' Robert Durst moves into Harlem townhouse | date=October 24, 2011}} Durst had been tipped off to the re-opened investigation into his wife's disappearance on October 31, 2000, and immediately began planning for life as a [[fugitive]]. Berman biographer [[Cathy Scott]] has asserted that Durst killed Berman because she knew too much about McCormack's disappearance.{{cite web|url=http://news3lv.com/archive/video-vault--murder-of-a-mafia-daughter-part-2 |title=Video Vault - Murder of a Mafia Daughter, Part 2 |date=June 4, 2014 |publisher=|accessdate=September 12, 2016 }}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} === {{anchor|Morris Black}} Killing and dismemberment of Morris Black=== On October 9, 2001, Durst was arrested in Galveston shortly after body parts belonging to his elderly neighbor, Morris Black, were found floating in [[Galveston Bay]]. He was released on $300,000 [[Recognizance|bail]] the next day. Durst missed a court hearing on October 16 and a warrant was issued for his arrest on a charge of [[bail jumping]]. On November 30, he was caught inside a [[Wegmans]] supermarket in [[Bethlehem, Pennsylvania|Bethlehem]], [[Pennsylvania]], after trying to shoplift a chicken salad sandwich on pumpernickel bread, Band-Aids, and a newspaper, even though he had $500 cash in his pocket.{{cite news|last1=Todt|first1=Ron|title=Fugitive heir Robert Durst arrested in Pennsylvania|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1876&dat=20011201&id=_TUfAAAAIBAJ&sjid=FdAEAAAAIBAJ&pg=5948,20163|work=[[Spartanburg Herald-Journal]]|date=December 1, 2001|location=[[Spartanburg, South Carolina]]}} A police search of his rented car yielded $37,000 in cash, two guns, [[marijuana]], Black's driver's license,{{cite news|title=Durst Waives Extradition To Texas Trial In Murder|author=Bagli, Charles V.|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2002/01/26/nyregion/durst-waives-extradition-to-texas-trial-in-murder.html |accessdate=March 14, 2015 | date=January 26, 2002}} and directions to the Connecticut home of Gilberte Najamy, a former confidante of McCormack who had dogged Durst for years publicizing accusations he had murdered his wife.{{cite news|url=https://nypost.com/2003/09/24/his-next-victim-he-had-directions-to-dead-wifes-pal/|title=His Next 'Victim': He Had Directions To Dead Wife's Pal|date=September 24, 2003|accessdate=April 21, 2015|work=[[New York Post]]|author=Andrea Peyser}}{{cite news|url=https://nypost.com/2003/09/26/the-durst-tapes-bitter-robert-planned-to-knock-off-his-brother/|title=The Durst Tapes: Bitter Robert Planned To Knock Off His Brother|author=Andrea Peyser|date=September 26, 2003|accessdate=April 20, 2015|work=[[New York Post]]}} Durst also used his time on the run to stalk his brother Douglas, visiting the driveway of his home in [[Katonah, New York]], while armed. Durst employed defense attorney [[John Waldron (lawyer)|John Waldron]] while he was held on charges in Pennsylvania. He was eventually extradited to Texas for trial. ====Trial==== In 2003, Durst was tried for the murder of Black. He employed defense attorney [[Dick DeGuerin]] and claimed [[self-defense]]; DeGuerin conducted two mock trials in preparation for the case.{{cite news|work=[[Mashable]]|date=March 17, 2015|accessdate=March 20, 2015|url=http://mashable.com/2015/03/16/galveston-judge-durst-acquittal-dangerous/|author=Pamela Chelin|title=Judge who presided over Robert Durst acquittal in Texas murder: 'He's very dangerous'}} Durst's defense team had difficulty communicating with him, so they hired psychiatrist Dr. Milton Altschuler to find out why. Altschuler spent over 70 hours examining Durst and diagnosed him with [[Asperger syndrome]], saying, "His whole life's history is so compatible with a diagnosis of Asperger's disorder." Durst's defense team argued at trial that the diagnosis explained his behavior.{{cite web | title = The Mystery of Robert Durst | author = Leung, Rebecca | publisher = [[CBS News]] | url = http://www.cbsnews.com/news/mystery-of-robert-durst-15-03-2004/ | accessdate = December 14, 2014}} Durst claimed he and Black, a cranky and confrontational loner, struggled for control of Durst's .22-caliber target pistol after Black grabbed it from its hiding place and threatened him with it. During the struggle, the pistol discharged, shooting Black in the face. During cross-examination, Durst admitted to using a paring knife, two saws, and an axe to dismember Black's body before bagging and dumping his remains in Galveston Bay.{{cite web | title = Prosecution forces Durst to admit his many lies | author = Springer, John | publisher = [[truTV]] | url = http://www.courttv.com/trials/durst/102703_ctv.html | accessdate = April 2, 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20031030130411/http://www.courttv.com/trials/durst/102703_ctv.html|archivedate=October 30, 2003}} Black's head was never recovered, so prosecutors were unable to present sufficient forensic evidence to dispute Durst's account of the struggle. As a result of lack of forensics, the jury acquitted Durst of murder.{{cite web |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050403214317/http://www.courttv.com/trials/durst/verdict_ctv.html |archivedate=April 3, 2005| title = Millionaire Durst acquitted of neighbor's murder | author = John Springer | publisher = [[truTV]] | url = http://www.courttv.com/trials/durst/verdict_ctv.html | accessdate = April 2, 2009}} In 2004, Durst pleaded guilty to two counts of bail jumping and one count of [[evidence tampering]]. As part of a [[plea bargain]], he received a sentence of five years and was given credit for time served, requiring him to serve three years in prison.{{cite web | title = Millionaire Robert Durst pleads guilty to bail jumping, evidence tampering | author = Su, Jessica | publisher = [[Court TV]] | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090309052640/http://www.courttv.com/trials/durst/092904_pleadeal_ctv.html | archivedate = March 9, 2009 | deadurl = yes | url = http://www.courttv.com/trials/durst/092904_pleadeal_ctv.html }} Durst was [[parole]]d in 2005. The rules of his release required him to stay near his home; permission was required to travel. That December, Durst made an unauthorized trip to the boarding house where Black had been killed and to a nearby shopping mall. At the mall, he ran into former Galveston trial judge Susan Criss, who had presided over his trial. Due to this incident, the [[Texas Department of Criminal Justice|Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles]] determined that Durst had violated the terms of his parole and returned him to jail.{{cite web | title = Billionaire Robert Durst back in jail | author = Abrams, Dan | publisher = [[MSNBC]] | url = http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/11024064/ | accessdate = April 2, 2009}} He was released again from custody on March 1, 2006.{{cite news|last=Moran|first=Kevin|title=Millionaire Durst allowed back to Houston home|url=http://www.chron.com/disp/story.mpl/front/3693768.html|accessdate=April 30, 2011|newspaper=[[Houston Chronicle]]|date=March 1, 2006}} Asked in March 2015 whether she believed Durst murdered Morris Black, Criss commented: "You could see that this person knew what they were doing and that it was not a first time. The body was cut perfectly like a surgeon who knew how to use this tool on this bone and a certain kind of tool on that muscle. It looked like not a first-time job. That was pretty scary." ==Legal proceedings== ===Firearm charge=== On March 16, 2015, DeGuerin advised court authorities in New Orleans that his client waived [[Extradition law in the United States#Interstate extradition|extradition]] and would voluntarily return to California.{{cite news|last1=Keneally|first1=Megan|title=Robert Durst: A Timeline of His Life and Alleged Crimes|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/robert-durst-timeline-life-alleged-crimes/story?id=29668632|accessdate=March 16, 2015|work=[[ABC News]]|date=March 16, 2015}} Late that same day, [[Louisiana State Police]] filed charges against Durst for being a felon in possession of a firearm and for possession of a firearm with a controlled substance, forestalling his immediate return to California.{{cite news|title=Louisiana State Police charge Robert Durst on gun, drug violations|url=http://www.wdsu.com/news/local-news/new-orleans/murder-suspect-robert-durst-to-return-to-los-angeles-after-waiving-extradition-hearing/31821748|accessdate=March 16, 2015|work=[[WDSU]]|date=March 16, 2015}} [[Orleans Parish]] District Attorney Leon Cannizzaro commented that, in light of prior convictions that could influence Durst's sentencing, "[j]ust for those gun charges here in Louisiana, [Durst] could face up to life in prison". On March 23, Durst was denied bail by a Louisiana judge after prosecutors argued he was a flight risk. In an effort to hasten his extradition to California and avoid a protracted Louisiana court battle,{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-robert-durst-attorneys-extradition-to-california-20150404-story.html|title=Robert Durst's attorneys ask judge to release him for extradition to California|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|author=Molly Hennessy-Fiske|date=April 4, 2015|accessdate=April 5, 2015}} DeGuerin raised questions about the validity of the New Orleans arrest and hotel room search, pointing out that a local judge did not issue a warrant until hours after his client was detained.{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-dursts-arrest-warrant-challenged-20150331-story.html|title=Durst arrest warrant should be 'thrown out,' attorneys say|date=March 31, 2015|accessdate=April 1, 2015|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|author=Molly Hennessy-Fiske}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/03/nyregion/robert-dursts-lawyers-say-try-to-call-agents-in-louisiana-case.html|title=Robert Durst's Lawyers Want to Call the Agents Who Arrested Him as Witnesses|date=April 2, 2015|accessdate=April 4, 2015|author1=Charles V. Bagli |author2=Marc Santora |lastauthoramp=yes |newspaper=[[The New York Times]]}}{{cite news|url=http://time.com/3768333/robert-durst-lawyers-fbi-hotel-room-search/|title=Durst Lawyers Say FBI Illegally Searched His Hotel Room|author=Janet McConnaughey|date=April 1, 2015|accessdate=April 4, 2015|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time/Associated Press]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150403041231/http://time.com/3768333/robert-durst-lawyers-fbi-hotel-room-search/|archivedate=April 3, 2015|df=mdy-all}} While communicating with the LAPD and conducting an inventory of Durst's hotel room possessions, "[t]he FBI ... held him there, incommunicado, for almost eight hours". According to DeGuerin, Durst was questioned extensively by a Los Angeles prosecutor and detective, without a lawyer present, on the morning after his arrest. In failing to produce the arresting officers [[subpoena]]ed for a [[probable cause]] hearing, Durst's attorneys charged that Louisiana prosecutors engaged in a "misguided attempt to conceal the facts from the court, the defendant, and the public."[http://www.click2houston.com/blob/view/-/32184994/data/2/-/u2plg0z/-/durst-pdf.pdf State of Louisiana v. Robert Durst: Defendant Robert Durst's Motion and Incorporated Memorandum For Finding Of No Probable Cause] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150923204641/http://www.click2houston.com/blob/view/-/32184994/data/2/-/u2plg0z/-/durst-pdf.pdf |date=September 23, 2015 }}, Click2houston.com, April 3, 2015; accessed April 6, 2015. Peter Mansfield, an Assistant [[U.S. Attorney]], said that his office instructed the two FBI agents and arresting officer not to appear, arguing that DeGuerin's subpoenas were issued in an attempt to conduct "actions against them in their official capacities for the purpose of obtaining testimony, information and material maintained under color of their official duties."{{cite news|date=April 8, 2015|accessdate=April 8, 2015|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|author=K. C. Baker|url=http://www.people.com/article/robert-durst-grand-jury-indicted-weapons-drug-charges|title=Robert Durst Indicted on Louisiana Drug and Weapons Charges}} On April 8, a day after the U.S. Attorney filed an independent federal weapons charge,{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/09/nyregion/robert-durst-indicted-on-gun-charges-in-new-orleans.html|title=Robert Durst Indicted on Gun Charges in New Orleans|author=Charles V. Bagli|date=April 8, 2015|accessdate=April 8, 2015|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]}} Durst was formally [[indictment|indicted]] by a Louisiana [[grand jury]] for carrying a weapon with a controlled substance and for the illegal possession of a firearm by a felon.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN0MZ1PS20150408|work=[[Reuters]]|date=April 8, 2015|accessdate=April 8, 2015|title=Real estate scion Robert Durst indicted on weapons charges in New Orleans|author=Jonathan Kaminsky}} Later that month, Durst's lawyers requested that more than $161,000 seized by authorities during their searches be returned, saying the cash "is not needed as evidence, is not contraband, and is not subject to forfeiture."{{cite news|date=April 17, 2015|accessdate=April 17, 2015|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/robert-durst/robert-durst-cops-i-want-117-000-you-seized-n343251|title=Robert Durst to Cops: I Want the $161,000 You Seized|author=Tracy Connor|work=[[NBC News]]}} After negotiations with Durst's defense team, Louisiana authorities ultimately dropped weapons charges against Durst on April 23, 2015.{{cite news|title=Louisiana gun case against millionaire Durst dropped, lawyer says|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2015/04/23/louisiana-gun-case-against-millionaire-durst-dropped-lawyer-says/|work=[[Associated Press|Associated Press (Fox News)]]|date=April 23, 2015|accessdate=April 23, 2015}} Durst's trial on the federal weapons charge was scheduled for September 21, 2015.{{cite news|url=http://www.chron.com/news/crime/article/US-judge-postpones-hearing-in-Durst-subpoena-FBI-6211800.php|date=April 20, 2015|accessdate=April 21, 2015|agency=Associated Press|title=US judge puts off Durst weapons charge trial until September|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150424021652/http://www.chron.com/news/crime/article/US-judge-postpones-hearing-in-Durst-subpoena-FBI-6211800.php|archivedate=April 24, 2015|df=mdy-all}} DeGuerin confirmed rumors that Durst was in poor health, stating that he suffers from [[hydrocephalus]] and had a [[stent]] put into his skull two years before, as well as spinal surgery and a [[cancer]]ous mass removed from his esophagus.{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/article/robert-durst-mental-state-after-murder-charges|title=Robert Durst 'Is Not Suicidal,' His Attorney Says|date=March 31, 2015|accessdate=April 1, 2015|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|author=K. C. Baker}} Durst's attorneys requested a later date for the federal weapons charge trial, saying they'd need more time to prepare after rulings on pending motions. U.S. District Judge Helen Berrigan later rescheduled the trial to January 11, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcdfw.com/news/local/Real-Estate-Heir-Robert-Dursts-Weapons-Trial-Postponed-to-January-320844481.html|title=Real Estate Heir Robert Durst's Weapons Trial Postponed|date=|work=NBC 5 Dallas-Fort Worth}} On November 16, 2015, a New Orleans federal judge ordered Durst re-arraigned on the weapons charges and scheduled a hearing for December 17. When asked, Durst's attorney said only that Durst did not kill Berman, and that he wants to resolve the other charges to expedite Durst's extradition to Los Angeles to face that charge.{{cite news| url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-robert-durst-rearraignment-louisiana-20151116-story.html |title=Is Robert Durst moving closer to answering a murder charge in L.A.? |work=Los Angeles Times |last=Hennessey-Fisk |first=Molly |date=November 16, 2015|accessdate=November 28, 2015}} On December 16, 2015, prosecutors and defense attorneys told Berrigan in a joint motion that scheduling conflicts ruled out all dates before a January 11 trial date. Berrigan ultimately rescheduled the trial for February 3, 2016, and Durst changed his plea to guilty to the federal gun charge and received an 85-month prison sentence.{{cite web|url=http://www.nola.com/crime/index.ssf/2015/12/robert_durst_wont_sign_new_orl.html|title=Robert Durst won't sign New Orleans plea deal this year|date=|work=NOLA.com}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20160129071311/http://abc13.com/news/robert-durst-to-enter-plea-on-gun-charge-in-february/1174443/ ]{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/02/04/nyregion/robert-durst-gun-charges.html?_r=0|title=Robert Durst Gun Charges|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=December 18, 2016}} ===Arrest for Berman murder=== A few days after a [[first-degree murder]] warrant was signed by a Los Angeles judge in relation to the Berman killing, Durst was arrested by [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] agents on March 14, 2015, at the [[New Orleans Marriott|Canal Street Marriott]] in New Orleans, where he had registered under the false name "Everette Ward".{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/24/nyregion/durst-is-denied-bail-at-hearing-in-new-orleans.html|title=Robert Durst Denied Bail as Prosecutors Argue He Is a Flight Risk|date=March 23, 2015|accessdate=March 23, 2015|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|author=Campbell Robertson}}{{cite news|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-robert-durst-worth-100-million-investigators-say-20150319-story.html|title=Robert Durst worth $100 million, investigators say|author=Molly Hennessy-Fiske|date=March 19, 2015|accessdate=March 20, 2015}} Durst, who had been tracked to the hotel after making two calls to check his [[voicemail]],{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/03/23/us/robert-durst-investigation/|title=Robert Durst denied bail; new details emerge in case|author1=Catherine E. Shoichet |author2=Eliott C. McLaughlin |lastauthoramp=yes |date=March 24, 2015|accessdate=March 24, 2015|work=[[CNN]]}} was observed wandering aimlessly in the lobby and mumbling to himself, having driven to New Orleans from Houston four days before.{{cite news|author1=Richard Winton, Matt Hamilton |author2=Shelby Grad |lastauthoramp=yes | title =Robert Durst was registered in hotel under false name, source says| quote =| newspaper =[[Los Angeles Times]]| date =March 15, 2015| url =http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-robert-durst-arrested-in-la-murder-case-20150315-story.html| accessdate =March 15, 2015}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/16/nyregion/robert-durst-subject-of-hbo-documentary-on-unsolved-killings-is-arrested.html|title=On HBO's 'The Jinx,' Robert Durst Says He 'Killed Them All'|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|author1=Charles V. Bagli |author2=Vivian Yee |date=March 15, 2015|accessdate=March 15, 2015}}{{cite news| author =Ashley Southall| title =Robert Durst, Subject of HBO Documentary on Unsolved Killings, Is Arrested| quote =| newspaper =[[The New York Times]]| date = March 15, 2015| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/16/nyregion/robert-durst-subject-of-hbo-documentary-on-unsolved-killings-is-arrested.html| accessdate =March 15, 2015}} In addition to a .38 revolver loaded with four live rounds and one spent shell casing, police recovered five ounces of marijuana, Durst's birth certificate and [[passport]], maps of Louisiana, Florida, and [[Cuba]],{{cite news|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2015/03/inside-robert-durst-arrest|title=Inside Robert Durst's New Orleans Arrest|date=March 24, 2015|accessdate=April 19, 2015|author=Julie Miller|work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]}} a "flesh-toned" latex mask, the fake Texas ID used to check into the hotel, a new cellphone, and cash totaling $42,631.{{cite news|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/robert-durst-had-mask-fake-id-42-000-cash-when-n325961|work=[[NBC News]]|author1=Andrew Blankstein |author2=Hannah Rappleye |lastauthoramp=yes |date=March 18, 2015|accessdate=March 18, 2015|title=Robert Durst Had Latex Mask, Fake ID and $42,000 Cash When Arrested}}{{cite news|title=Durst had revolver, 5 ounces of marijuana, Louisiana warrant says|url=http://www.nola.com/crime/index.ssf/2015/03/durst_had_revolver_5_ounces_of.html|date=March 17, 2015|accessdate=March 19, 2015|author=Ken Daley|work=[[The Times-Picayune]]}}{{cite news|url=http://www.abcnews.com/US/robert-durst-found-stash-cash-fake/story?id=29744828|title=Durst Had Stash of Cash, Latex Mask, Fake ID, Passport, Police Say|date=March 19, 2015|accessdate=March 19, 2015|work=[[ABC News]]|author=Matt Gutman}} Police discovered a [[United Parcel Service|UPS]] tracking number, which led to an additional $117,000 cash in a package sent to Durst by a friend in New York,{{cite news|title=FBI believes Robert Durst is 'romantically linked' to New York woman|url=http://www.theneworleansadvocate.com/news/12250175-172/fbi-believes-robert-durst-is|date=May 1, 2015|accessdate=May 2, 2015|author=Matt Sledge|work=[[The Advocate (Louisiana)|New Orleans Advocate]]}} which was seized after his arrest. Bank statements found in one of Durst's Houston condominiums revealed cash withdrawals of $315,000 in little more than a month. On March 15, 2015, New York State Police investigator Joseph Becerra, long involved with the McCormack case, and said to be working closely in recent months with the FBI and Los Angeles detectives,{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2015/03/15/durst-hbo-charged/24806525/|title=Did subject of HBO documentary really 'kill them all'?|work=[[USA Today]] and [[The Journal News]]|author1=John Bacon |author2=Jonathan Bandler |lastauthoramp=yes |date=March 16, 2015|accessdate=March 21, 2015}} removed some sixty file boxes of Durst's personal papers and effects from the home of Durst's friend Susan T. Giordano in [[Campbell Hall, New York]], where they had been sent by his present wife Debrah Lee Charatan three years prior for safekeeping. Also stored there were videotaped depositions of Durst, Charatan, and Douglas Durst, all related to the Black case.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/21/nyregion/in-robert-durst-murder-case-authorities-seize-personal-papers-used-by-filmmakers.html |title=Robert Durst's Papers Are Seized From Hudson Valley Cellar|date=March 20, 2015|accessdate=March 21, 2015|author=Charles V. Bagli|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]}} [[Los Angeles County]] [[District Attorney|Deputy District Attorney]] John Lewin, in charge of prosecuting Durst, claimed to have found information uncovered by the filmmakers in the [[HBO]] documentary series ''[[The Jinx (miniseries)|The Jinx]]'' to be compelling and repeatedly flew to New York to interview witnesses, including friends of Durst and Berman.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/02/04/nyregion/robert-durst-gun-charges.html|title=Robert Durst Gun Charges|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=December 18, 2016}} The trial was scheduled to begin in Los Angeles after Durst was [[arraignment|arraigned]] in California, but his transfer was delayed by the [[U.S. Bureau of Prisons]] due to "serious surgery", according to DeGuerin.{{cite web|author=Chris Harris |url=http://www.people.com/article/lawyer-says-medical-complications-delaying-robert-dursts-extradition |title=Robert Durst: 'Medical Complications' Delaying Extradition, Says Lawyer |website=People.com |date= |accessdate=December 18, 2016}} Durst pleaded not guilty on November 7, 2016.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/08/nyregion/robert-durst-pleads-not-guilty-to-2000-murder-in-los-angeles.html|title=Robert Durst Pleads Not Guilty to 2000 Murder in Los Angeles|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=December 18, 2016}} The trial was postponed to April 16, 2018, to accommodate Durst's defense team, some of whom suffered damage to their homes and offices from [[Hurricane Harvey]].{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-la-durst-hearing-20170920-story.html|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|accessdate=September 23, 2017}} The pretrial hearings included extensive testimony from a number of older witnesses who potentially would not be available when the trial itself begins. In October 2018, Los Angeles Country Superior Judge Mark Windham ruled there is enough evidence to try Durst for the murder of Berman, and Durst will be arraigned November 8, 2018. The following day during his court appearance, Durst pled not guilty.{{cite web|url=https://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/local/Robert-Durst-Pleads-Not-Guilty-Friends-Benedict-Canyon-Slaying-500161671.html|title=Robert Durst Pleads Not Guilty in Friend's Benedict Canyon Slaying|publisher=}} The death date for Kathleen Durst has been changed to be most likely at the time she disappeared in 1982 due to murder instead of the previous determination of 1987 for a missing person.{{cite web|url=https://www.law.com/newyorklawjournal/2018/05/30/appeals-court-adjusts-death-date-in-case-of-robert-dursts-wife/?slreturn=20180527154939|title=Appeals Court Adjusts Death Date in Case of Robert Durst's Wife - New York Law Journal|publisher=}} ==Other cases== Days after the Berman murder, police were reportedly examining connections between Durst and disappearances of 17-year-old Lynne Schulze from [[Middlebury, Vermont]],{{cite news|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/robert-durst/robert-durst-case-missing-student-lynne-schulze-shopped-his-business-n329551|title=Robert Durst Case: Missing Student Lynne Schulze Shopped at His Business: Cops|date=March 24, 2015|accessdate=March 24, 2015|work=[[NBC News]]}} and 16-year-old Karen Mitchell from [[Eureka, California]].{{cite news|last1=Winton|first1=Richard|title=Robert Durst linked to Vermont student who vanished in 1971; police investigating|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-police-investigating-robert-durst-vermont-student--20150323-story.html|accessdate=March 23, 2015|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=March 23, 2015}}{{cite news|url = http://www.krcrtv.com/law-enforcement-looking-connection-between-teen-millionaire/31933838|title = Family friend recalls missing Eureka teen|author = Candase Chambers|date = March 20, 2014|accessdate = March 24, 2015|work = [[KRCR-TV]]|lay-url = }}{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/03/19/us/robert-durst-cold-cases/|title=Could Robert Durst be tied to other cold cases? FBI is investigating|date=March 17, 2015|accessdate=March 25, 2015|work=[[CNN]]|author=Catherine E. Shoichet, Evan Perez, [[Shimon Prokupecz]] and Dan Simon}} Investigators are also looking into a possible connection with the disappearance of 18-year-old [[Kristen Modafferi]], last seen in San Francisco in 1997.{{cite web|last1=Trinh|first1=Jean|title=Robert Durst Could Be Linked To Disappearance Of Two California Teens In The '90s|url=http://laist.com/2015/03/18/robert_durst_california_teens.php|website=LAist.com|accessdate=March 25, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150320200527/http://laist.com/2015/03/18/robert_durst_california_teens.php|archivedate=March 20, 2015|df=mdy-all}}{{cite news|last1=Gould|first1=Martin|title=Sister of missing teen begs accused killer Robert Durst to 'come clean' to help end 18 years of agony for her family|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3004677/Sister-missing-teen-begs-accused-killer-Robert-Durst-come-clean-help-end-18-years-agony-family.html|accessdate=March 25, 2015|date=March 24, 2015}} Schulze, a [[Middlebury College]] freshman, visited Durst's health food store on December 10, 1971, the day she disappeared, and was last seen that afternoon near a bus stop across from the store.{{cite news|url=http://www.courant.com/community/simsbury/hc-simsbury-lynne-schulze-robert-durst-20150324-story.html|title=Robert Durst Linked To Disappearance Of College Student From Simsbury|date=March 24, 2015|accessdate=April 16, 2015|author=Kristin Stoller|work=[[Hartford Courant]]}} DeGuerin characterized the Schulze investigation as "opportunistic" and said he would not permit his client to be questioned by Vermont police.{{cite news|date=March 25, 2015|accessdate=April 4, 2015|url=http://www.click2houston.com/news/sheriff-recalls-memories-of-robert-durst-and-his-store-in-vermont/32011202|title=Robert Durst's attorney says he will not let Vermont police talk to his client|author=Jace Larson|work=[[KPRC-TV]]}} Author and investigative journalist [[Matt Birkbeck]] reported in 2003, and again in his 2015 book ''[[A Deadly Secret]]'', that credit card records placed Durst in Eureka on November 25, 1997, the day Mitchell vanished. Mitchell may have volunteered in a homeless shelter that Durst frequented; Durst, dressed in women's clothing, had visited the Eureka shoe store owned by Mitchell's aunt.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/apr/19/robert-durst-karen-mitchell-mary-casper-california|title='We haven't been able to rule him out': Robert Durst and another cold case|work=[[The Guardian]]|author=Michelle Dean|date=April 19, 2015|accessdate=April 19, 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.willitsnews.com//general-news/20121202/humboldt-cold-case-investigators-remember-karen-mitchell-15-years-after-she-disappeared|title=Humboldt cold case: Investigators remember Karen Mitchell 15 years after she disappeared|work=[[Times-Standard]]|author=Kaci Poor|date=December 2, 2012|accessdate=April 16, 2015}} Mitchell was last seen walking to work from her aunt's store and possibly speaking to someone in a stopped car; a witness sketch of Mitchell's presumed abductor resembles Durst. Although the FBI ultimately could not connect Durst to the [[Long Island serial killer|Long Island serial murders]] (in which some victims were disposed similarly to the Black killing), the Bureau created an informal task force in 2012 to work with investigative agencies in jurisdictions where Durst was known to have lived in past decades, including Vermont, New York, and California.{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-fbi-durst-link-cold-cases-20150318-story.html|title=FBI tells law enforcement to search for Durst link in cold cases|date=March 18, 2015|accessdate=April 19, 2015|author=Richard Winton|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]}} In the wake of his recent arrest, the FBI encouraged such localities to re-examine cold cases. Texas private investigator [[Bobbi Bacha]] has also traced Durst operating under stolen identities in Texas, Florida, [[Massachusetts]], [[New Jersey]], [[South Carolina]], [[Mississippi]], and [[Virginia]].{{cite book|author=[[Matt Birkbeck]]|title=[[A Deadly Secret: The Strange Disappearance of Kathie Durst|A Deadly Secret: the Bizarre and Chilling Story of Robert Durst]]|year=2005|publisher=Berkley (Penguin Random House LLC)|isbn=978-1-101-98742-1|page=257}} ==Documentary== In early 2015, a six-part HBO documentary titled ''[[The Jinx (miniseries)|The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst]]'' described circumstantial evidence linking Durst to the murder of Berman, who was believed to have knowledge of McCormack's disappearance.{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/features/2015-03-13/will-an-hbo-documentary-finally-nail-bobby-durst-|title=Will An HBO Documentary Finally Nail Bobby Durst? A Conversation With Jeanine Pirro|author=Lisa DePaulo|date=March 13, 2015|accessdate=March 15, 2015|work=[[Bloomberg News]]}} The documentary detailed the disappearance of McCormack, Berman's subsequent death, and the killing of Black. Against the advice of his lawyers{{cite news|url=http://gothamist.com/2015/03/24/robert_dursts_lawyer_insists_he_was.php|title=Robert Durst's Lawyer Insists He Was "Tricked" By The Jinx|date=March 24, 2015|accessdate=April 17, 2015|author=Jen Chung|work=[[Gothamist]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150422014620/http://gothamist.com/2015/03/24/robert_dursts_lawyer_insists_he_was.php|archivedate=April 22, 2015|df=mdy-all}} and his wife Debrah Lee Charatan, Durst gave multiple interviews and unrestricted access to his personal records to the filmmakers.{{cite news|url=http://www.capitalnewyork.com/article/media/2015/04/8565993/emtimesem-charles-bagli-bob-durst-and-hbos-jinx|title=The Times' Charles Bagli on Bob Durst and HBO's 'The Jinx'|author=Jeremy Barr|work=[[Capital New York|Politico (CapitalNewYork.com)]]|date=April 14, 2015|accessdate=April 16, 2015}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/01/nyregion/robert-dursts-wife-steps-back-after-years-of-defending-him.html|title=Robert Durst’s Wife Steps Back After Years of Defending Him|date=April 1, 2015|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]}} The FBI arrested Durst in New Orleans on the same day as the final episode was broadcast. The documentary ended with him moving into a bathroom where his [[Microphone gaffe|microphone recorded him saying to himself]]: "There it is. You're caught! What the hell did I do? Killed them all, of course."{{cite news|last1=Petski|first1=Denise|title=Robert Durst Of ‘The Jinx’ To Be Extradited To Los Angeles For Murder Charge – Update|url=http://deadline.com/2015/12/robert-durst-of-the-jinx-arrested-on-los-angeles-county-murder-warrant-1201392983/|accessdate=December 20, 2016|work=Deadline|publisher=Penske Business Media, LLC.|date=December 23, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Bagli|first1=Charles V.|last2=Yee|first2=Vivian|title=Robert Durst of HBO’s ‘The Jinx’ Says He ‘Killed Them All’|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/16/nyregion/robert-durst-subject-of-hbo-documentary-on-unsolved-killings-is-arrested.html?_r=0|accessdate=December 20, 2016|work=The New York Times|date=March 15, 2015}} The [[Associated Press]] reported that a March 1999 letter from Durst to Berman, discovered by her stepson and turned over to the filmmakers during their research,{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/tv/showtracker/la-et-st-susan-berman-murder-investigation-the-jinx-20150309-story.html|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=March 9, 2015|accessdate=March 18, 2015|author=Meredith Blake|title=D.A. reopening inquiry into death of 'The Jinx's' Susan Berman, report says}} provided "key new evidence" leading to the filing of murder charges.{{cite news|url=http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/U/US_REAL_ESTATE_HEIR_UNSOLVED_MURDER|title=Durst's letter helped prosecutors bring murder charge|date=March 17, 2015|accessdate=March 17, 2015|author1=Janet McConnaughey |author2=Brian Melley |lastauthoramp=yes |work=Associated Press}} ==Personal life== On April 12, 1973 – Durst's 30th birthday – he married Kathleen McCormack. Durst divorced her in 1990, eight years after her disappearance, claiming spousal abandonment.{{cite news |author1=Charles V. Bagli |author2=Kevin Flynn |lastauthoramp=yes | title =Heir Divorced His Missing Wife 11 Years Ago| quote =Robert A. Durst, heir to a real estate fortune, quietly divorced his long-missing wife in 1990 without the knowledge of her grieving family or friends.| newspaper =[[The New York Times]]| date = December 22, 2001| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2001/12/22/nyregion/heir-divorced-his-missing-wife-11-years-ago.html| accessdate =March 15, 2015}} On December 11, 2000, shortly before the Berman killing, Durst married Debrah Lee Charatan.{{cite news|author=Charles V. Bagli|title=For Heir Accused of Killing, a Loyal and Tough Ally|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2003/09/20/nyregion/for-heir-accused-of-killing-a-loyal-and-tough-ally.html|accessdate=March 15, 2015|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=September 20, 2003}}{{cite news|last1=Gould Keil|first1=Jennifer|title=Wife of real estate heir Robert Durst sells Fifth Avenue pad|url=https://nypost.com/2014/11/26/wife-of-real-estate-heir-robert-durst-sells-fifth-avenue-pad/|work=[[New York Post]]|accessdate=March 15, 2015|date=November 16, 2014}}{{cite news|url=https://nypost.com/2015/03/18/dursts-wife-is-the-mastermind-behind-couple-sources-say/|title=Durst's wife is the 'mastermind' behind couple|date=March 18, 2015|accessdate=March 18, 2015|work=[[New York Post]]|author1=Jennifer Gould Keil |author2=Kate Sheehy |lastauthoramp=yes }} According to ''The New York Times'', the couple briefly shared a [[Fifth Avenue]] apartment in 1990 but "have never lived together as husband and wife". Durst once told his sister that it was "a marriage of convenience"; "I wanted Debbie to be able to receive my inheritance, and I intended to kill myself," Durst said in a 2005 deposition. Charatan currently lives with one of Durst's lawyers, Steven I. Holm. Durst traveled and lived under dozens of aliases over the years,{{cite news|url=http://www.newsweek.com/what-it-was-work-robert-durst-315251|title=What it was like to work for Robert Durst|work=[[Newsweek]]|date=March 20, 2015|accessdate=March 23, 2015|author=Polly Mosendz}} using different identities to buy cars, rent apartments, and open credit card accounts. "He had a scanner, copier, and a laminating machine," a former office employee of Durst told ''[[Newsweek]]''. "What I didn't realize is that I unwittingly saw what would have allowed Robert Durst to make a fake driver's license." Durst was also "a prolific user of private mailboxes," and apparently conducted business under a number of canine-themed names: Woofing LLC, WoofWoof LLC, and Igor-Fayette Inc. In the early 1980s, Durst owned a series of seven [[Alaskan Malamute]]s each named Igor, which according to his brother Douglas all died under mysterious circumstances. In December 2014, prior to the airing of ''The Jinx'', Douglas told ''The New York Times'' that, "In retrospect, I now believe he was practicing killing and disposing [of] his wife with those dogs."{{cite news|quote="Before the disappearance of my sister-in-law, Bob had a series of Alaskan Malamutes, which is like a husky," Douglas said. "He had seven of them, and they all died, mysteriously, of different things, within six months of his owning them. All of them named Igor. We don't know how they died, and what happened to their bodies. In retrospect, I now believe he was practicing killing and disposing of his wife with those dogs." What led him to that conclusion, Douglas said, was that Robert turned the word "Igor" into a verb and inflected it with a menace: "When he was in jail in Pennsylvania, he was recorded saying, 'I want to Igor Douglas.'"|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=January 1, 2015|accessdate=March 23, 2015|title=Real Estate Chief Fears Troubled Sibling Has New Weapon: TV|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/01/02/nyregion/series-on-troubled-scion-of-durst-real-estate-family-has-critic-his-brother.html|author=Jim Dwyer}} Durst was once recorded saying he wanted to "Igor" Douglas.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/25/nyregion/for-durst-family-arrest-brings-a-tremendous-sense-of-relief.html|date=March 24, 2015|accessdate=March 24, 2015|author=Jim Dwyer|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|title=For Durst Family, Arrest Brings a 'Tremendous Sense of Relief'}} Durst, however, has disputed the notion that he owned seven dogs named Igor; he owned three, he said, one that was run over and another that died in surgery after eating an apple core, "before the Igor that lasted forever." In late 1981, while Durst was still married to McCormack, he was nearing the end of a three-year affair with Prudence Farrow, who was also married at the time. A few months before McCormack's disappearance in January 1982, Farrow called her and asked that she give him up, as friends said she wanted him all to herself. After Durst's acquittal of murdering Black in 2003, Farrow contacted law enforcement authorities with concerns for her safety, as she said Durst was angry with her for terminating their relationship three days before McCormack disappeared.{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2015/03/28/woman-who-inspired-the-beatles-dear-prudence-once-dated-robert-durst/|title=Woman who inspired The Beatles’ ‘Dear Prudence’ once dated Robert Durst - New York Post|date=March 28, 2015|work=New York Post}} ===Financial status and residences=== In mid 2002, Durst signed over a [[power of attorney]] to his wife Charatan, a real estate investor, and it is believed their holdings remain closely intermingled.{{cite news|url=http://www.newsweek.com/shadowy-history-robert-dursts-real-estate-holdings-314764|work=[[Newsweek]]|title=The Shadowy History Of Robert Durst's Real Estate Holdings|author=Polly Mosendz|date=March 18, 2015|accessdate=March 18, 2015}} In 2006, Durst gave Charatan around $20 million of his $65 million trust settlement. In 2011, Durst purchased a $1.75 million townhouse on [[Lenox Avenue]] in [[Harlem]]. A source close to his estranged family confirmed that he was living there at least some of the time, and they were keeping him under surveillance.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/mar/23/tracking-robert-durst-whats-he-still-hiding|title=Tracking Robert Durst, from condos to secret dog stores: what's he still hiding?|author1=Michelle Dean |author2=Tom Dart |lastauthoramp=yes |date=March 23, 2015|accessdate=March 23, 2015|work=[[The Guardian]]}}{{cite journal|last1=Reilly|first1=Richard Byrne|title=Cross-Dressing Convict Robert Durst Returns to New York|journal=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|date=February 4, 2011|url=http://nymag.com/daily/intel/2011/02/robert_durst_returns_to_new_yo.html}} Durst also owns three [[condominium]]s in a multi-story complex in Houston, and after filing suit, received a $200,000 settlement in 2006 from a Houston developer who refused to let him move into a unit newly purchased by his wife, which she had then immediately resold to Durst for $10.{{cite news|title=Robert Durst booked a profit on Houston condo he never moved into|url=https://nypost.com/2015/04/21/robert-durst-booked-a-profit-on-texas-condo-he-never-moved-into/|author=Lois Weiss|work=[[New York Post]]|date=April 21, 2015|accessdate=April 22, 2015}}{{cite news|date=May 8, 2015|accessdate=May 12, 2015|url=http://m.click2houston.com/news/a-look-at-robert-dursts-time-living-in-houston/32904208|title=A look at Robert Durst's time living in Houston|author1=Jace Larson |author2=Debbie Levy Strauss |lastauthoramp=yes |work=[[KPRC-TV]]}} At the time of Berman's murder in Los Angeles, Durst had just sold a home in [[Trinidad, California|Trinidad]], California, but maintained an office in Eureka while renting in nearby [[Big Lagoon (California)|Big Lagoon]].{{cite news|date=November 29, 2001|accessdate=April 19, 2015|url=http://www.northcoastjournal.com/112901/news1129.html|title=Manhunt has Humboldt Connection: Case on America's Most Wanted Saturday|work=[[North Coast Journal]]}} Media have variously reported Durst's financial status as "real estate baron", "rich scion", "millionaire", "multimillionaire",{{cite web |url=https://nypost.com/2014/07/22/real-estate-heir-robert-durst-charged-for-urinating-on-candy-at-drug-store/ |title=Multimillionaire killer charged for urinating on candy at drugstore |work=NY Post |author=Bob Fredericks |date=July 22, 2014 |accessdate=March 15, 2015}} and "billionaire". The Durst family's real estate holdings are worth more than $4 billion, but his brother Douglas was in control of the company beginning in 1994, shortly before their father's death.{{cite web |url=https://www.cnbc.com/id/102507985 |title=What is Robert Durst really worth? |work=CNBC |author=Robert Frank |date=March 16, 2015 |accessdate=March 16, 2015}} From about 1994 to 2006, Robert waged a legal campaign to gain greater control of the family trust and fortune. During that time he received $2 million a year from the trust. In 2006 the case was settled, with Durst giving up any interest in his family's properties and trusts in exchange for a one-time payment of about $65 million.{{cite news|last1=Bagli|first1=Charles|title=Durst Cuts Ties to Family in Return for $65 Million|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/02/07/nyregion/07durst.html|accessdate=March 15, 2015|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=February 7, 2006}} It is unknown how much of that went to legal fees and taxes. Durst was still active in real estate; he reportedly sold two properties in 2014 for $21.15 million after purchasing them in 2011 for $8.65 million.{{cite web |url=https://nypost.com/2014/07/14/ex-con-robert-durst-made-a-killing-flipping-nyc-real-estate/ |title=Cross-dressing killer now making a killing in NYC real estate |work=NY Post |author=Jennifer Gould Keil |date=July 14, 2014 |accessdate=March 15, 2015}} At the time of his 2015 arrest, the FBI estimated Durst's net worth at approximately $100 million; ''The New York Times'' estimated his net worth at $110 million. On May 1, 2015, the ''[[New York Post]]'' reported that Douglas had settled litigation against ''Jinx'' filmmaker [[Andrew Jarecki]], having confirmed that Robert was the source of videotaped depositions that appeared in the documentary. Robert's disclosure apparently violated the terms of his 2006 agreement with the Durst family, which had dispersed to him a lump sum of family trust assets. Although it was unclear whether Jarecki confirmed Robert as his source—''The New York Times'' reported in March 2015 that Jarecki was given "unrestricted access" to Robert's personal records, including the videotaped material—the settlement paves the way for Douglas to reclaim as much as $74 million of his brother's assets, effectively freezing those assets pending court judgment. This could affect Robert's ability to pay for high-caliber legal representation without tapping into real estate or other investments. The ''Post'' reported that Douglas was "mulling his next move".{{cite news|last1=Marsh|first1=Julia|title=Brother could freeze Robert Durst's millions following legal deal|url=https://nypost.com/2015/05/01/brother-could-freeze-robert-dursts-millions-following-legal-deal/|accessdate=May 1, 2015|work=[[New York Post]]|date=May 1, 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://www.capitalnewyork.com/article/media/2015/04/8566749/robert-dursts-brother-drops-action-against-hbo-filmmaker|date=April 24, 2015|accessdate=April 25, 2015|title=Robert Durst's brother drops litigation against HBO filmmaker|work=[[Capital New York]]|author=Ryan Hutchins}} In November 2015, nearly 34 years after her disappearance, McCormack's three sisters and 101-year-old mother sued Durst for $100 million, citing his apparent role in her murder and his denial to her family of the "right to sepulcher", a New York law that grants immediate relatives access to a deceased person's body and the opportunity to determine appropriate burial.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/01/nyregion/family-of-robert-dursts-first-wife-sues-him-for-100-million-in-her-disappearance.html|title=Family of Robert Durst's First Wife Sues Him for $100 Million in Her Disappearance|work=The New York Times|first=Charles V.|last=Bagli|date=November 30, 2015|accessdate=December 1, 2015}} If successful, the lawsuit could deprive Durst of most or all of his inherited fortune. McCormack's brother James had attempted in October 2015 to file a [[wrongful death]] suit against Durst on behalf of his mother, but was challenged by one of his sisters, who holds her mother's power of attorney. DeGuerin commented that "there is no evidence that Robert Durst had anything to do with Kathleen's disappearance. Anybody can file a lawsuit, but eventually they'll have to come with evidence." On December 7, 2015, the same family members filed a suit asking the court to freeze Durst's assets. The family's attorney, Robert Abrams, called Durst the "poster child" for why courts block defendants from disposing assets while civil lawsuits are pending.{{cite news|url=http://www.lohud.com/story/news/crime/2015/12/09/durst--laws-want-assets-frozen-during-civil-suit/77057986/|title=Durst in-laws want assets frozen during civil suit|work=The Journal News|first=Jonathan|last=Bandler|date=December 10, 2015|accessdate=December 11, 2015}} In July 2016, the McCormack family asked the Surrogate’s Court in Manhattan to "declare that Kathie died on January 31, 1982, when she was murdered by her husband, Robert Durst" so the sepulcher lawsuit can proceed.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/15/nyregion/family-of-robert-dursts-first-wife-asks-court-to-declare-her-dead.html?ref=topics&_r=0|title=Family of Robert Durst's First Wife Asks Court to Declare Her Dead|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=December 18, 2016}} ===Other legal issues=== In 2012 and 2013, Durst's family members sought and received restraining orders against him, claiming they were afraid of him. Durst was charged with trespassing in New York for walking in front of townhouses owned by his brother Douglas and other family members. He went on trial and was acquitted in December 2014. The judge also vacated the thirteen orders of protection his family members had taken out on him.{{cite news| author =Charles V. Bagli| title =Robert Durst, Troubled Scion of Real Estate Family, Is Acquitted of Trespassing| quote =| newspaper =[[The New York Times]]| date =December 11, 2014| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/12/nyregion/robert-durst-troubled-scion-of-real-estate-family-is-acquitted-of-trespassing.html| accessdate =March 15, 2015}}{{cite news| title =Judge Acquits Robert Durst In Trespassing Case| quote =| newspaper =[[WCBS-TV|CBS New York]]| date = December 11, 2014| url =http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2014/12/11/judge-acquits-robert-durst-in-trespassing-case/| accessdate =March 15, 2015}}{{cite news| author = Sebastien Malo| title =New York real estate scion acquitted of trespassing on family property| quote =| newspaper =[[Reuters]]| date = December 11, 2014| url =https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/12/12/us-people-robertdurst-idUSKBN0JQ00W20141212| accessdate =March 15, 2015}} In July 2014, Durst was arrested after turning himself in to police following an incident at a Houston [[CVS Pharmacy|CVS]] drugstore in which he allegedly exposed himself without provocation and urinated on a rack of candy. He then left the store and casually walked down the street. Durst was charged with misdemeanor criminal mischief.{{cite web | title = Durst accused of urinating on candy at CVS | author = Rice, Harvey|date= July 22, 2014 | publisher = ''[[Houston Chronicle]]'' | url = http://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/article/Durst-accused-of-urinating-on-drugstore-candy-5637119.php | accessdate = July 24, 2014}}{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2014/07/24/wealthy-eccentric-urinated-candy-cvs/13085499/|title=Robert Durst: From riches to allegedly peeing on candy|last=Diebel|first=Matthew|date=July 24, 2014|publisher=USA Today|accessdate=July 24, 2014}} In December 2014, he pleaded "[[Nolo contendere|no contest]]" and was fined $500. His lawyer described the incident as an "unfortunate medical mishap", as Durst had just been released from a hospital where he had undergone two medical procedures.{{cite news| author = Brian Rogers| title =Durst pleads 'no contest' in CVS urination incident| quote = | newspaper =[[Houston Chronicle]]| date = December 16, 2014| url =http://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/article/Durst-pleads-guilty-in-CVS-incident-5960352.php| accessdate =March 15, 2015}}{{cite news| title =Robert Durst fined $500 after urinating on candy at CVS| quote =| newspaper =[[KHOU]]| date = December 16, 2014| url =http://www.khou.com/story/news/crime/2014/12/16/robert-durst-fined-500-after-allegedly-urinating-on-candy-at-cvs/20484435/| accessdate =March 15, 2015}}{{cite news|date=May 6, 2015|accessdate=May 12, 2015|url=http://m.click2houston.com/news/video-released-of-robert-durst-urinating-in-houston-drug-store/32850412|title=Video released of Robert Durst urinating in Houston drug store|work=[[KPRC-TV]]}} The incident was recorded on videotape. ==In popular culture== * The events surrounding Durst inspired the 2010 film ''[[All Good Things (film)|All Good Things]]'', the title of which is a reference to a health food store of the same name set up by Durst and his wife in the 1970s. David Marks, the character based on Durst, was portrayed by [[Ryan Gosling]].{{cite web| url = http://www.observer.com/2008/real-estate/robert-durst-inspired-feature-film-hit-big-screen-09| title = Ryan Gosling Is Robert Durst| author = Rubinstein, Dana| publisher = ''[[The New York Observer]]''| date = August 8, 2008| accessdate = August 15, 2008}}{{cite web| url = http://galvestondailynews.com/story.lasso?ewcd=af24d8c229d3acba&-session=TheDailyNews:42F941281412000E30XWTx6B42E2| title = Movie based on Durst's wife's disappearance| author = Jones, Leigh| publisher = ''[[The Galveston County Daily News]]''| date = August 22, 2008| accessdate = August 25, 2008| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20081206105343/http://galvestondailynews.com/story.lasso?ewcd=af24d8c229d3acba&-session=TheDailyNews%3A42F941281412000E30XWTx6B42E2| archivedate = December 6, 2008| df = mdy-all}} Shortly after its theatrical release, Robert Durst saw the film and contacted director Andrew Jarecki, expressing admiration for the film, which evolved into discussions between the two of them being included on the DVD video release, and eventually resulting in Jarecki co-writing, co-producing, directing, and appearing in the 2015 HBO six-part documentary series on Durst, ''[[The Jinx (miniseries)|The Jinx]]''. * Three episodes in the [[Law & Order (franchise)|''Law & Order'' television franchise]] gave different takes on the murders: The ''[[Law & Order]]'' episode "[[Hands Free (Law & Order)|Hands Free]]"; the ''[[Law & Order: Criminal Intent]]'' episode "[[Maledictus]]"; and the ''[[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]]'' episode "[[Devil's Dissections]]".{{cite news|work=Entertainment Weekly|date=August 10, 2015|accessdate=September 26, 2015|first=Amanda Michelle|last=Steiner|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/08/10/law-order-svu-season-premiere-robert-durst|title=Law & Order: SVU: Two-hour premiere to explore Robert Durst case}} * [[Fred Armisen]] played Robert Durst in a 2003 sketch on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' and again in 2016 on ''[[Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt]]''.{{cite web|url=http://snl.jt.org/detail.php-i=200311156.html |title=SNL Archives | Episodes | Details |website=Snl.jt.org |date=November 15, 2003 |accessdate=December 18, 2016}} [[Kate McKinnon]] played Robert Durst in a 2015 SNL sketch.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbc.com/saturday-night-live/video/improv-show/2855733 |title=Watch Improv Show From Saturday Night Live |website=NBC.com |date= |accessdate=December 18, 2016}} *The American Court TV (now [[TruTV]]) television series ''Mugshots'' released an episode covering Durst, titled ''Robert Durst - Mogul in Murder Mystery''.{{cite web|title=MUGSHOTS: Robert Durst – Mogul in Murder Mystery|url=http://filmrise.com/mugshots-robert-durst-mogul-in-murder-mystery/|website=FilmRise|accessdate=8 November 2017}} *A&E and Lifetime announced in August 2016 that they were developing a movie based on the book [[A Deadly Secret: The Strange Disappearance of Kathie Durst|''A Deadly Secret'']]. The television movie, titled ''The Lost Wife of Robert Durst'', originally aired on November 11, 2017.{{cite news|last1=CAIN|first1=BROOKE|title=What to Watch on Saturday: Lifetime’s Robert Durst movie, Larry David on ‘SNL’|url=http://www.newsobserver.com/entertainment/tv/warm-tv-blog/article181847446.html|accessdate=March 25, 2018|work=newsobserver|date=November 11, 2017|language=en|quote=The Lost Wife of Robert Durst (8 p.m., Lifetime) – New York real estate scion Robert Durst has ...}}{{cite news |last1=Petski |first1=Denise |title=Robert Durst Movie In Works At Lifetime |url=https://deadline.com/2016/08/robert-durst-movie-in-works-lifetime-bettina-gilois-matt-birkbeck-1201807663/ |accessdate=4 September 2018 |work=Deadline |date=23 August 2016}} ==References==
